column2: You're back, Captain! *Lonroe looks at you extremely satisfied.* You've completed your assignment, yes?
Not yet, I have no bodies.
First monster is done.
My men shot the second monster. Did you know it burned some words in the walls of his lair with acid?
The third one… It's going to be funny, but it killed itself.
About the fourth creature…
Then come back when you have some! Don't waste my time and your own, Captain.
Of course. Over and out.
Great, simply wonderful! Send the corpse over, and I'll transfer you the money.
Pleasure to work with you.

But still, it attacked your people, Captain. That means it wasn't intelligent. Don't let your conscience eat you from the inside, my friend. You're doing a good thing. Send the corpse to me and I'll transfer you the money.
Doing a good thing? I really hope I am. Over and out.
Really? Are you serious?
And a long time before we came, too. It slit its own throat. And it was trying to write poetry.
*Lonroe clicks a sad, somber rhythm.* Too bad. Maybe it really was intelligent. I hope we can find that out soon through studying its corpse. Here's your money.
Of course. Over and out.
Yes?
I brought it alive. It's intelligent.
My people couldn't find it.
I decided to keep it.
What? Are you sure about that? *Lonroe leans forward, he's shocked.*
Absolutely. I had a long conversation with it. There's definitely something wrong with its head, but I wouldn't call it stupid.

So that's how it is... So, after all... Ahem. *Lonroe leans back and smiles.* This is just wonderful news, human captain. You deserve a bonus. You're one of the best investments ever made by the Vortangu Corp.
Glad to hear that. Always a pleasure to work with people like you.
*Lonroe frowns.*
We searched the whole planet, combed it with scanners. Nothing. Looks like it managed to climb into some deep hole and die there.

Let it rest in peace, then. *Lonroe is annoyed, he draws his speech slowly and petulantly.* I think you understand that I cannot pay for such a voyage. There is nothing to pay you for. There is nothing to discuss there. It was a pleasure to work with you, human captain. Not as good as I expected, but pleasant. *The connection breaks. Lonroe simply signed off.*
So that's how it is. He really got mad.
So what are you going to do with it, human captain? *Lonroe laughs.* Sic it on your enemies like a pet animal?
Could be. But probably not. It's intelligent.
That's none of your business.
You're right, it is. I guess it's no use telling you that you're holding corporate assets... Let it be like that, human captain. You aren't getting paid for your voyage, I think that much is obvious.
I didn't expect anything different.
*Lonroe nods. His voice is quiet and silky.* Looks like the rumors about you were greatly exaggerated, Captain… *He shakes his head and signs off.*
They say a lot of things about me. Although… He can't hear me anyway.
In that case, you must hand it over to us. It is our corporate asset. We can study it, help it... Human captain, you're making a mistake!
You're right. You know what… take it, after all.
It wanted to stay. I can't force it to go.

*Lonroe leans back and smiles.* It's a good thing you changed your mind. Trust me, we won't harm that creature. As for you... You deserve a bonus. You're one of the best investments ever made by the Vortangu Corp.
Glad to hear that. Over and out, Lonroe.

*Lonroe is annoyed. His skin is covered in big drops of slime.* Yes. You're right. *His answers sound like hissing.* This is unethical. Let it be like that. Keep that creature. You won't get any money for it, of course. And you don't look like you need it, anyway. *The connection drops. Looks like someone disconnected too quickly.*
If he doesn't calm down, he'll explode all over his office. His office is cool. I'd like one like that... hm... Maybe I could ask Sarah to renovate my quarters…
